intro: Taraxacum pyrrhopappum, commonly known as the red-rayed leopard butterfly plant, is a species of dandelion native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow flower heads and distinctive, reddish-purple bracts that surround the base of the flower. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are typically hairy and have a slightly lobed appearance. Its flowering period occurs from late spring to early summer, and it produces a single, showy flower per stem. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
